member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuColorTool
member.summary: A button tool that maintains a selected .

remarks.para: The RadialMenuColorTool displays like a normal RadialMenuTool with an image and text. In addition to all of the normal RadialMenuTool functionality, the Color Tool maintains a selected property.

If the parent of a is a RadialMenuColorToolBase, then the child RadialMenuColorToolBase will attempt to set the parent RadialMenuColorToolBase's Color to it's selected Color any time the Color property of the child RadialMenuColorToolBase is changed, or the property of the child RadialMenuColorToolBase is set to true. To set the Color of a RadialMenuColorTool without affecting the parent tool, use the method and specify false for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded'.
The property allows you to specify which color (if any) within the image of the tool that will be replaced by the currently selected color.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuColorToolBase

To set the Color of a RadialMenuColorTool without affecting the parent tool, use the method and specify false for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded'.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool
member.summary: A tool that can be displayed by the component.

remarks.para: RadialMenuTool is the most basic tool type. This tool represents a button that displays an image and text and occupies one or more wedges (or the center button) of the .
A RadialMenuTool may be made to act as a state button by setting the property to true. See the , , and properties for more information on how to work with state buttons.

When a tool is set as the , the tool's will be applied to the center button. The tools in the collection of the center tool are arranged around the menu clockwise. See , , and for more information on positioning tools on the menu.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.SetChecked(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the property of the tool and optionally fires the event and synchonizes the parent tools.
member.param: The new checked state value.
True to fire the ToolClick event; otherwise false.
True to have the tool synchronize it's parent tools, if appropriate.
True to update the LastToggledTool property of the parent tool, if appropriate.
member.remarks: The 'synchParentToolIfNeeded' parameter allows you to specify whether the tool should synchronize the properties of it's parent tools or not. For example, clicking on a to check it will automatically check it's parent tool (depending on the parent tool's ) and update the parent tool's Color property (if the parent is a .) Specifying true for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded' will act the same as if the user clicked the tool. But this may not always be desirable, so specifying false will change the Checked state of the tool without affecting the parent or ancestor tools.

member.summary: Sets the property of the tool and optionally fires the event.
member.param: The new checked state value.
True to fire the ToolClick event; otherwise false.

member.summary: This method is called by a child to on it's parent to indicate that a synchronizing event has occurred, such as the changing of the Checked property or changing the Color or Value of the tool in order to give the parent tool the opportunity to take on the child tool's settings.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Checked state of the tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.ChildToolDisplayStyle
member.summary: Determines how the children in the collection of this tool are displayed.

remarks.para: By default (ChildToolDisplayStyle.DrillDown), a tool will display a DrillDown button (if it's Tools collection has visible tools in it). When the user clicks the DrillDown button, the tool becomes the and it's Tools are be displayed in wedges around the radial menu.
When set to ChildToolDisplayStyle.None, the tool will not display a DrillDown button or it's child tools.

When set to ChildToolDisplayStyle.AsSiblingsWhenChecked, the tool will not display a DrillDown button, but when the tool is , it will display it's tools as sibling to itself. Child tools displayed as sibling will honor the property. But if this is not set, they will display at the end of the list, after the parent tool and all of it's siblings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.ChildToolCheckBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets how tools in the collection behave with respect to each other.

remarks.para: This property determines how many tools in a collection can be checked at the same time. The property is set on the parent tool and determines how many of the child tools of that tool may be checked.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.ChildToolRelativeOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets how the children of this tool are aligned relative to the parent tool.

remarks.para: This property determines whether the children of this tool are aligned to the parent tool. By default, child tools are positioned using the proprety, or if VisiblePosition is not set, by starting at position zero and arranging tools clockwise around the menu. This property allows you to apply a rotation to the child menu such that a particular child tool will always appear in the same position as the parent tool. Note that VisiblePosition of the child tools is not affected. Tools are still positioned relative to position 0 on the menu, but the menu itself is then rotated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.DrillDownButtonEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the drilldown button of the tool is enabled.

remarks.para: When DrillDownButtonEnabled is set to Default, the enabled state of the drilldown button will be determined by the property of the tool and the tool type. For a simple , the Enabled property will have no effect on the drilldown button and the user will be allowed to drill down regardless of the Enabled state. For a , drilling down and selecting a child color could affect the parent tool's color, so the Enabled property on the tool will affect the drildown button.
Setting DrillDownButtonEnabled to True or False will enable or disable the drilldown button of the tool, irrespective of the Enabled property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state of the tool.

remarks.para: A disabled tool cannot be clicked or drilled down via the user interface and will not show a tooltip.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.KeyTip
member.summary: Gets or sets a string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic displayed for the tool when using keytips.

remarks.p: Key tips are displayed when the Alt key is pressed.
If the key tip for a tool conflicts with another tool in the same container, this key tip may be changed.
By default, if the key tip is not set for a tool, a unique key tip will be auto-generated for the tool. must be False for key tips to not auto-generate.

member.exception: The value assigned has more than 3 characters.

The property is modified at design-time for a tool in an defined on a base Form or UserControl. Inherited tools must be modified at run-time or at design-time through the designer of the Form or UserControl they were created on.
member.value: A string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic displayed for the tool when using keytips.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.LastToggledChildTool
member.summary: Returns the last child of this tool that was whose property was toggled by the user.

remarks.para: This property returns the last child of this tool which was checked or unchecked by the user, or which was toggled via a simulated user action such as the method or setting the property. The last checked tool may be different than the currently checked child tool(s), because the SetChecked method also allows the setting of the Checked property without affecting the parent tool. This is useful for cases where the checked state of the child tool(s) reflects the current state of the application (such as the selected text), but the parent tool's functionality should still act on behalf of the last child tool the user checked.

member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the tool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool.VisiblePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the visible position of the tool.

remarks.para: The VisiblePosition allows you to position a tool at a particular wedge in the menu. By default, positions start at the top of the menu and continue around the menu clockwise. The starting position can be changed via the and / or properties. By default, the VisiblePosition of a tool is -1, which indicates that the tool will fill the first position in which it can fit (see ). Tools whose VisiblePositions are set to something other than -1 have precedence over tools whose VisiblePositions are -1. So they are positioned first. Tools with a VisiblePosition of -1 are then placed into the first open slot into which they can fit completely. If two tools have the same VisiblePosition (other than -1), then the first tool in the Tools collection will take precendence and the successive tools may not be displayed or may be only partially displayed. For example, if tool A has a VisiblePosition of 2 and a WedgeSpan of 1, and tool B has a VisiblePosition of 2 and a WedgeSpan of 2, tool A will be completely visible in position 2 and tool B will be partially visible in position 3 (assuming there is no tool with a VisiblePosition of 3). Tools whose VisiblePosition exceed the WedgeCount of the menu will not be displayed. Tools whose total VisiblePosition and WedgeSpan exceed the wedge count, will be partially displayed.

member.summary: Sets the property of the and optionally fires the event and synchonizes the parent tools.
member.param: The new color value.
True to fire the ColorChanged event; otherwise false.
True to have the tool synchronize it's parent tools, if appropriate.
True if the action that is causing the color change was initiated by the userl as opposed to the programmer.
member.remarks: The 'synchParentToolIfNeeded' parameter allows you to specify whether the tool should synchronize the properties of it's parent tools or not. For example, clicking on a to check it will automatically check it's parent tool (depending on the parent tool's ) and update the parent tool's Color property (if the parent is a .) Specifying true for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded' will act the same as if the user clicked the tool. But this may not always be desirable, so specifying false will change the Color of the tool without affecting the parent or ancestor tools.

member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected color of the tool.

remarks.para: If the parent of a is a RadialMenuColorToolBase, then the child RadialMenuColorToolBase will attempt to set the parent RadialMenuColorToolBase's Color to it's selected Color any time the Color property of the child RadialMenuColorToolBase is changed, or the property of the child RadialMenuColorToolBase is set to true. To set the Color of a RadialMenuColorTool without affecting the parent tool, use the method and specify false for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded'.

member.summary: A special that maintains a selected and displays as a color well.

remarks.para: The RadialMenuColorWellTool does not support image or text and will display as a color well. If this tools parent or any of it's uncle tools are also RadialMenuColorWellTool, then the tool will show a preview of the ancestor color in the inner ring.

If the parent of a is a RadialMenuColorToolBase, then the child RadialMenuColorToolBase will attempt to set the parent RadialMenuColorToolBase's Color to it's selected Color any time the Color property of the child RadialMenuColorToolBase is changed, or the property of the child RadialMenuColorToolBase is set to true. To set the Color of a RadialMenuColorTool without affecting the parent tool, use the method and specify false for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuListTool.SelectedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates which item on the list is selected.

remarks.para: When the user selects an item from the list, the SelectedValue is set to the of that .

When the SelectValue changes, either by user action or in code, the event will fire. To set the SelectedValue without firing the event, use the method and specify false for the 'fireEvents' parameter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuListTool.ValueList
member.summary: Gets or sets the ValueList used by the tool

remarks.p: Note: The developer is responsible for disposing any external ValueList that is assigned to this property; the tool will only dispose ValueLists that are created internally. This means that if there are two tools, A and B, if B is assigned the ValueList that is created by A, if A is disposed, B will have a disposed ValueList. In this case, a new, blank ValueList will be created the next time that B needs to access the ValueList property. In order to work around this issue, it is recommended that a ValueList be created manually and assigned to each tool, ensuring that the list is disposed properly.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.NumericGaugeToolTickmarksCollection
member.summary: A collection of instances.

remarks.para: The tickmarks collection controls the tickmarks that are displayed by the . The gauge will display a tickmark and a label for each tickmark in the order in which the tickmarks exist within the collection. Typically, each tickmark's value will progress in relation to the previous tickmark, but this progression need not be linear or in the same direction and it is valid to have two tickmarks in a row with the same value.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic displayed for the tickmark when using keytips.

remarks.p: Key tips are displayed when the Alt key is pressed.
If the key tip for a tickmark conflicts with another tickmark in the same container, this key tip may be changed.
By default, if the key tip is not set for a keytip, a unique key tip will be auto-generated for the tickmark. must be False for key tips to not auto-generate.

member.exception: The value assigned has more than 3 characters.

The property is modified at design-time for a tickmark in an defined on a base Form or UserControl. Inherited tickmarks must be modified at run-time or at design-time through the designer of the Form or UserControl they were created on.
member.value: A string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic displayed for the tickmark when using keytips.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuNumericTool
member.summary: A tool that has a numeric value and can be displayed by the component.

remarks.para: RadialMenuNumericTool support all of the same functionality as a and also has a Value property to keep track of a numeric value.
The property of the tool gets or sets the current value.

The displays the current value as a string, positioned relative to the tool's image. The relative position of the value label can be adjusted using the . The appearance of the value label is determined by the . The value label can be hidden by setting to DefaultableBoolean.False.
As with all properties on the class, the of the individual tool will override the on the component.

If the parent of a is a RadialMenuNumericToolBase, then the child RadialMenuNumericToolBase will attempt to set the parent RadialMenuNumericToolBase's Value to it's Value any time the Value property of the child RadialMenuNumericToolBase is changed. To set the Value of a RadialMenuNumericToolBase without affecting the parent tool, use the method and specify false for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded'.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuNumericGaugeTool
member.summary: A tool that displays a gauge which displays a range of numeric values and allows the user to choose a value.

remarks.para: The property of the tool gets or sets the current value.

The RadialMenuNumericGaugeTool will not display an image or the tool's and it does not support child tools. Instead, the gauge displays a gauge a track and tickmarks defined by the collection. Setting the property will have no effect - the resolved WedgeSpan is always one less than the Count of the Tickmarks collection.
The displays the current value using a needle which points to the value on the gauge. The color of the needle can be set using the property.
As with all properties on the class, the of the individual tool will override the on the component.

If the parent of a is a RadialMenuNumericToolBase, then the child RadialMenuNumericToolBase will attempt to set the parent RadialMenuNumericToolBase's Value to it's Value any time the Value property of the child RadialMenuNumericToolBase is changed. To set the Value of a RadialMenuNumericToolBase without affecting the parent tool, use the method and specify false for 'synchParentToolIfNeeded'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuNumericGaugeTool.Tickmarks
member.summary: A collection of instances.

remarks.para: The tickmarks collection controls the tickmarks that are displayed by the . The gauge will display a tickmark and a label for each tickmark in the order in which the tickmarks exist within the collection. Typically, each tickmark's value will progress in relation to the previous tickmark, but this progression need not be linear or in the same direction and it is valid to have two tickmarks in a row with the same value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuEventManager.InProgress(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuEventIds)
member.summary: Returns True if the event is in progress (in progress count > 0).
member.param: A value indicating the event to check.

remarks.p: Use this method to determine whether the code of an event is currently being executed. You may want to know whether an event is occurring before disabling it.
The "in progress" count is used to account for recursive calls to events. You can use it to determine how many nested calls to an event have been made and which level of recursion is now executing.

member.returns: True if the specified event is currently being fired; False otherwise.

member.summary: Gets or returns Properties related to the radial menu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.Shared.IMenuSettings.CenterButtonImageSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the image in the center button. The center button itself will be increased in size to provide a circular border around the image.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.Shared.IMenuSettings.OuterRingThickness
member.summary: Gets the thickness of the outer ring of the menu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.Shared.IMenuSettings.RotationAsPercentageOfWedge
member.summary: Gets the rotation of the menu as a percentage of the wedge.
member.remarks: Wedges are positioned on the menu starting from 0 degrees at the very top of the menu and the proceeding clockwise. The rotatation is express as a percentage of the arc of a wedge. A value of 0 would align the left edge of the first wedge to the top center of the menu. A value of -0.5 (the default) is minus half of one wedge. This centers the first wedge at the top of the menu by offsetting it counter-clockwise by half of the total wedge arc. A value of -1 would align the right edge of the first wedge to the top center of the menu. This property is cumulative with .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.Shared.IMenuSettings.RotationInDegrees
member.summary: Gets the rotation of the menu in degrees
member.remarks: Wedges are positioned on the menu starting from 0 degrees at the very top of the menu and the proceeding clockwise. RotationInDegrees allows you to rotate the menu by an arbitrary number of degrees. This property is cumulative with .

member.summary: Gets the Size of the menu when expanded

member.summary: Gets the number of wedges available in the radial menu.

member.summary: Gets the spacing between wedges in degrees

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.CenterButtonClickAction
member.summary: Enumeration of actions that can occur when the center button of the radial menu is clicked.

remarks.para: This enumeration is used by the event.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.CenterButtonClickAction.None
member.summary: No action is taken.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.CenterButtonClickAction.ToggleExpansion
member.summary: Toggles the expanded state of the menu.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.CenterButtonClickAction.Back
member.summary: Navigates back up one level of the tool tree.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolDisplayStyle
member.summary: Enumeration that determines how a tool displays it's child tools.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolDisplayStyle.None
member.summary: This tool will never display any child tools. The tool will not display a DrillDown button.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolDisplayStyle.DrillDown
member.summary: This tool will display a DrillDown button (if it's Tools collection has visible tools in it), and the child tools will be displayed in wedges only when this tool is the CenterTool.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolDisplayStyle.AsSiblingsWhenChecked
member.summary: When this tool is checked, it's child tools will be displayed as siblings. The tool will not display a DrilLDown button. Child tools shown as siblings are always shown after all other siblings in the collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolCheckBehavior
member.summary: Enumeration which determines how many children of a tool can be at the same time.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolCheckBehavior.One
member.summary: There must be one, and only one, checked tool in the collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolCheckBehavior.OneOrNone
member.summary: There may be one or zero checked child tools at any time, but but never more than one.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolCheckBehavior.Any
member.summary: The child tools may be checked independently and changing the checked state of one tool has no effect on the other tools in the collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolRelativeOrigin
member.summary: Enumeration which determines how chils tools are positioned relative to the parent tool.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolRelativeOrigin.None
member.summary: The children of the tool are not aligned to the parent tool - they begin at position zero.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.ChildToolRelativeOrigin.AlignLastToggledToolToParent
member.summary: The last checked child tool of the tool will be positioned to the same resolved VisiblePosition as the parent tool.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction
member.summary: Enumeration which contains constants that identify the actions that can be performed on the control.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.NextItem
member.summary: The next item is activated. Activation proceeds from the center button to the first menu item and then in a clockwise direction around the menu and then back to the center button.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.PreviousItem
member.summary: The previous item is activated. Activation proceeds from the center button to the last menu item and then in a counter-clockwise direction around the menu and then back to the center button.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.ClickCurrentItem
member.summary: Activate current item. Simulates a click on the currently active item.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.DrillDown
member.summary: Drills down into the currently selected menu tool.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.NavigateBack
member.summary: Navigates back to the previous center tool as though the user clicked the center button.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.Collapse
member.summary: Collapses the menu.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.ToggleExpansion
member.summary: Toggles the expanded state of the menu.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.Close
member.summary: Closes the radial menu

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.IncrementNumericGauge
member.summary: Increments the value of a NumericGaugeTool.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenuAction.DecrementNumericGauge
member.summary: Decemrents the value of a NumericGaugeTool.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the border around the radial menu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.BorderStyleCenterButton
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the border around the center button.

remarks.para: The center button border is a circular border drawn around the image. When the radial manu has keyboard focus, this border will be doubled (two concentric circles). Both borders will use the same style.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.BorderStyleInnerRing
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the border between the outer ring and the inner ring.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.BorderStyleOuterRing
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the border around the outer ring.

remarks.para: This border will draw on both the inner and outer edges of the outer ring. If you want a border only around the outer edge, use the property. If you want a border only between the inner and outer rings, use the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.CenterButtonImageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the image in the center button.

remarks.para: This property sets the size of the center button image. The center button itself will be larger than the image because the button needs to draw a border around the image.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.CenterButtonKeyTip
member.summary: Returns or sets a string with a maximum of 3 characters that represents the mnemonic that is displayed for the center button when using keytips.

remarks.p: Key tips are displayed when the menu is showing and the Alt key is pressed.
If the key tip for the center button conflicts with another tool in the same menu, this key tip may be changed.

By default, if the key tip is not set for the center button menu, a unique key tip will be auto-generated.
must be False for key tips to not auto-generate.

member.exception: The value assigned has more than 3 characters.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.OuterRingThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the outer ring of the menu.

remarks.para: The outer ring thickness does not affect the size of the menu. Rather, the thickness of the outer ring is taken away from the inner ring.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.RotationAsPercentageOfWedge
member.summary: Gets or sets the the rotation of the menu as a percentage of the wedge.
member.remarks: Wedges are positioned on the menu starting from 0 degrees at the very top of the menu and the proceeding clockwise. The RotationAsPercentageOfWedge is expressed as a percentage of the arc of a wedge. This makes it ideal for adjusted the rotation such that a particular wedge is aligned to an angle on the menu circle. A value of 0 would align the left edge of the first wedge to the top center of the menu. A value of -0.5 (the default) is minus half of one wedge. This centers the first wedge at the top of the menu by offsetting it counter-clockwise by half of one wedge. A value of -1 would align the right edge of the first wedge to the top center of the menu. This property is cumulative with .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.RotationInDegrees
member.summary: Gets or sets the the rotation of the menu in degrees.
member.remarks: Wedges are positioned on the menu starting from 0 degrees at the very top of the menu and the proceeding clockwise. RotationInDegrees allows you to rotate the menu clockwise by an arbitrary number of degrees. Negative values are allowed. This property is cumulative with .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the total size of the radial menu when expanded.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.WedgeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of wedges available in the radial menu.

remarks.para: The radial menu is divided into wedges or slots which may be filled by tools. All wedges are the same size in degrees and the size of each wedge is 360 divided by the WedgeCount. While all wedges must be the same size, a tool may span more than one wedge. See .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.MenuSettings.WedgeSpacingInDegrees
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing in between wedges in degrees.

remarks.para: This property determines how much of a gap there is between tools in adjacent wedges.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.PerformDrillDown(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.RadialMenuTool,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Drills down into the sub-menu of a currently-displayed tool, as though the user clicked on the DrillDown button.

remarks.para: This method is the equivalent of the user clicking on the DrillDown button of a tool. This method may be called on a tool that is not displaying a drilldown button and / or has no child tools. The specified tool becomes the and displays it's child tools on the menu.
This method will fail if the specified tool is not currently displayed on the menu. To set the center tool to a tool that is not currently displayed, use the CenterTool property.

member.param: true to indicate that the drilldown was triggered by a keytip.
member.exception: The specified tool is not currently displayed in the menu.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.ResolveMenuAppearance(Infragistics.Win.AppearanceData@,Infragistics.Win.AppearancePropFlags@)
member.summary: Returns an AppearanceData object with its properties set to the actual values that will be used to display the object.

remarks.p: Examining the value of an Appearance object property that has not been set will return the "use default" value, not the internal value that is actually being used to display the object affected by the Appearance object. In order to find out what values are being used, you must use the ResolveAppearance method. This method will evaluate the property values of an Appearance object and return an Appearance object with all of its properties set to meaningful values that can be used to determine how the object will look.

When you change the properties of an Appearance object, you are not required to specify a value for every property that object supports. Whether the Appearance object is a stand-alone object you are creating from scratch, or an intrinsic object that is already attached to some other object, you can set certain properties and ignore others. The properties you do not explicitly set are given a "use default" value that indicates there is no specific setting for that property.

Properties that are set to the "use default" value derive their settings from other objects by following an appearance hierarchy. In the appearance hierarchy, each object has a parent object from which it can inherit the actual numeric values to use in place of the "use default" values. The "use default" value should not be confused with the initial setting of the property, which is generally referred to as the default value. In many cases, the default setting of an object's property will be "use default"; this means that the property is initially set not to use a specific value. The "use default" value will be 0 for an enumerated property (usually indicated by a constant ending in the word "default", such as AlignDefault) or -1 (0xFFFFFFFF) for a numeric setting, such as that used by color-related properties.

So for example, if the Appearance object of a cell has its BackColor property set to -1, the control will use the setting of the row's BackColor property for the cell, because the row is above the cell in the appearance hierarchy. The top level of the appearance hierarchy is the UltraWinGrid control itself. If any of the UltraWinGrid's Appearance object properties are set to their "use default" values, the control uses built-in values (the "factory presets") for those properties. For example, the factory preset of the BackColor property of the grid's Appearance object is the system button face color (0x8000000F). This is the value that will be used for the grid's background color when the BackColor property of the grid's Appearance object is set to the "use default" value.

The ResolveAppearance method will return an Appearance object with all of its "use default" settings converted into actual values. It does this by navigating the appearance hierarchy for each property until an explicit setting or a factory preset is encountered. If you simply place a grid on a form, run the project, and examine the setting of the BackColor property of the grid's intrinsic Appearance object:
MsgBox Hex(UltraGrid1.Appearance.BackColor)
...you will see that it is set to the "use default" value (0xFFFFFFFF). However, if you use the ResolveAppearance method to return the same value:
MsgBox Hex(UltraGrid1.ResolveAppearance.BackColor)

...you will see that it is set to the system button face color (0x8000000F). Note that this code takes advantage of the fact that the ResolveAppearance method returns an Appearance object to simplify the code that must be written. This code could be written out in a longer form as follows:
Dim objAppearance as Infragistics.Win.Appearance
Set objAppearance = UltraGrid1.ResolveAppearance
MsgBox Hex(objAppearance.BackColor)

member.param: The structure to contain the resolved apperance.
Bit flags indictaing which properties to resolve.

remarks.p: Examining the value of an Appearance object property that has not been set will return the "use default" value, not the internal value that is actually being used to display the object affected by the Appearance object. In order to find out what values are being used, you must use the ResolveAppearance method. This method will evaluate the property values of an Appearance object and return an Appearance object with all of its properties set to meaningful values that can be used to determine how the object will look.

When you change the properties of an Appearance object, you are not required to specify a value for every property that object supports. Whether the Appearance object is a stand-alone object you are creating from scratch, or an intrinsic object that is already attached to some other object, you can set certain properties and ignore others. The properties you do not explicitly set are given a "use default" value that indicates there is no specific setting for that property.

Properties that are set to the "use default" value derive their settings from other objects by following an appearance hierarchy. In the appearance hierarchy, each object has a parent object from which it can inherit the actual numeric values to use in place of the "use default" values. The "use default" value should not be confused with the initial setting of the property, which is generally referred to as the default value. In many cases, the default setting of an object's property will be "use default"; this means that the property is initially set not to use a specific value. The "use default" value will be 0 for an enumerated property (usually indicated by a constant ending in the word "default", such as AlignDefault) or -1 (0xFFFFFFFF) for a numeric setting, such as that used by color-related properties.

So for example, if the Appearance object of a cell has its BackColor property set to -1, the control will use the setting of the row's BackColor property for the cell, because the row is above the cell in the appearance hierarchy. The top level of the appearance hierarchy is the UltraWinGrid control itself. If any of the UltraWinGrid's Appearance object properties are set to their "use default" values, the control uses built-in values (the "factory presets") for those properties. For example, the factory preset of the BackColor property of the grid's Appearance object is the system button face color (0x8000000F). This is the value that will be used for the grid's background color when the BackColor property of the grid's Appearance object is set to the "use default" value.

The ResolveAppearance method will return an Appearance object with all of its "use default" settings converted into actual values. It does this by navigating the appearance hierarchy for each property until an explicit setting or a factory preset is encountered. If you simply place a grid on a form, run the project, and examine the setting of the BackColor property of the grid's intrinsic Appearance object:
MsgBox Hex(UltraGrid1.Appearance.BackColor)
...you will see that it is set to the "use default" value (0xFFFFFFFF). However, if you use the ResolveAppearance method to return the same value:
MsgBox Hex(UltraGrid1.ResolveAppearance.BackColor)

...you will see that it is set to the system button face color (0x8000000F). Note that this code takes advantage of the fact that the ResolveAppearance method returns an Appearance object to simplify the code that must be written. This code could be written out in a longer form as follows:
Dim objAppearance as Infragistics.Win.Appearance
Set objAppearance = UltraGrid1.ResolveAppearance
MsgBox Hex(objAppearance.BackColor)

member.param: The tool whose appearance will be resolved.
The structure to contain the resolved apperance.
Bit flags indictaing which properties to resolve.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.ActiveControlOfActiveForm
member.summary: Gets the leaf active control of the active form. If this is overridden in derived classes, it should call the base implementation first. If the base returns null, additional code should be used to find the active control of the active form. All toolbars managers used in an application should have the same implementation of this property or inconsistent behavior will occur.

member.summary: Returns the event handler that notifies OnSubObjectPropChanged

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.Appearances
member.summary: Returns the appearances collection.

remarks.p: The Appearances collection is a colletion of Appearances supplied for convenience. The Appearances in this collection have no direct effect on any object in the control. They are intended to be used as a repository of standard appearances which can then be applied to object in the control by assigning the appearance of the object to one of the items in the collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.AutoGenerateKeyTips
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to auto generate key tips for items in the radial menu when the key tip has not already been specified.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.CenterTool
member.summary: Gets or sets the tool in the center of the menu.

remarks.para: The center tool determines the appearance of the button in the center of the radial menu. The children of the center tool are (usually) displayed in the wegdes surrounding the center button.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.CreationFilter
member.summary: Returns or sets an object implementing the interface. This object is invoked during the print operation to allow for manipulation of the positioning and creation of uielements.

remarks.p: Returns or sets the object used to manipulate the size, creation and positioning of elements. The property of the controls created for the print operation will be initialized to this propertys value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.CurrentState
member.summary: Returns a value which represents the current state of the control

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.CursorFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor filter property

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.DrawFilter
member.summary: Returns or sets an object implementing the interface. This object is invoked during the print operation to allow elements to be owner drawn.

remarks.p: Returns or sets the class used to owner draw sections of the print results. The property of the controls created for the print operation will be initialized to this propertys value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.EventManager
member.summary: The object that enables, disables and controls firing of specific component events.

remarks.p: The EventManager provides a high degree of control over how the control invokes event procedures. You can use it to selectively enable and disable event procedures depending on the context of your application. You can also use the event radialMenu to return information about the state of the control's events.

The event radialMenu's methods are used to determine the enabled state of an event (), to selectively enable or disable events (), and to determine whether an event procedure is currently being processed (). There is also an property that you can check to quickly determine whether any events have been disabled by the event radialMenu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets the expanded state of the menu.

remarks.para: When not expanded, all areas of the menu are hidden except for the center button. Clicking the center button in this state will expand the menu and show the children of the arranged into the wedges around the menu.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.ImageList
member.summary: Gets or sets the ImageList that contains the Image objects used by the tools.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinRadialMenu.UltraRadialMenu.ImageTransparentColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparent color used when drawing tool images.

remarks.p: When set to a color other than Color.Transparent (the default), all occurrences of the color in the image will be made transparent.

If a tool image is supplied by setting an Appearance.Image property to an Imagelist index, the ImageLists TransparentColor property is looked at first. If the property is set to Color.TransparentColor, then the components ImageTransparentColor is used. If it is set to Color.TransparentColor, then no color masking is done.
If a tool image is supplied by setting the Appearance.Image property to an image, the components ImageTransparentColor is used. If it is set to Color.TransparentColor, then no color masking is done.
